facts.description: We can tell who our owners are! We know if they're here or not!
facts.author: AceKiron

facts.description: We all have our own personalities!
facts.author: AceKiron

facts.description: We love people!
facts.author: AceKiron

facts.description: Don't touch us too often, you may damage our slime coat and it may hurt.
facts.author: AceKiron

facts.description: We are near extinct. Raise some of your own axolotls with proper care to help us!
facts.author: AceKiron

facts.description: Axolotls have 4 fingers, but 5 toes!
facts.author: AceKiron

facts.description: We don't have eyelids, so make sure to put hides for us to rest our little eyes.
facts.author: AceKiron

facts.description: We are carnivorous, so the best diet for us are dendrobaena worms or night crawlers.
facts.author: AceKiron

facts.description: We live in cold water, ideally between 16째C - 18째C. That's 60.8째F - 64.4째F if you're American.
facts.author: AceKiron

facts.description: We are nocturnal! If you see us not doing much during the day, that's normal.
facts.author: AceKiron

facts.description: Blood worms are a good snack for us, but only as snacks because they don't have nutrients.
facts.author: AceKiron

facts.description: Never take us out of the water as we're fully aquatic!
facts.author: AceKiron

facts.description: We are native to only Lake Xochimilco.
facts.author: AceKiron

facts.description: We're added to Minecraft.
facts.author: unknown

facts.description: We have amazing regenerative abilities, we can regenerate almost any part of our body, including parts of our heart and parts of our brains.
facts.author: AceKiron

facts.description: We have both gills and lungs, but don't take us out of the water.
facts.author: AceKiron

facts.description: Our species is named after the Aztec god Xolotl.
facts.author: AceKiron

facts.description: We're very resistant to cancer.
facts.author: AceKiron

facts.description: Scientists are studying us in the hopes to make humans regenerate lost limbs.
facts.author: AceKiron

facts.description: It doesn't hurt when we accidentally bite you.
facts.author: AceKiron

facts.description: We absolutely love begging our owners for food when we see them.
facts.author: AceKiron

facts.description: We're great pets, but not easy to take care of.
facts.author: AceKiron

facts.description: Water flow shouldn't be too strong, it stresses us out.
facts.author: AceKiron

facts.description: You can tell if we are stressed by looking at how curved forward our gills are, a hooked tail is also a sign of stress.
facts.author: AceKiron

facts.description: We have poor eyesight, so we often mistake things for food.
facts.author: AceKiron

facts.description: We're opportunistic hunters.
facts.author: AceKiron

facts.description: Make sure you can take care of us before actually buying your own axolotl.
facts.author: AceKiron

facts.description: Bare bottom or fine sand! We'll eat everything that fits in our mouth, so don't use gravel.
facts.author: AceKiron

facts.description: Wild axolotls are rarely white or pink.
facts.author: AceKiron

facts.description: We exhibit Neoteny.
facts.author: AceKiron

facts.description: We eat by using suction, not by chewing our food.
facts.author: AceKiron

facts.description: Axolotls have very few predators.
facts.author: AceKiron

facts.description: Adult males have a longer tail than the females and a swollen cloaca which is lined with papilae.
facts.author: unknown

facts.description: The males often grow longer than the females, but not always.
facts.author: AceKiron

facts.description: Our breeding season typically runs from March to June.
facts.author: AceKiron

facts.description: Researchers are encouraging axolotls to breed by building 'shelters' in Xochimilco.
facts.author: AceKiron

facts.description: Axolotls begin the breeding process with a waltz, it's the initiation phase of mating. Both the male and female will rub and slide against the other's cloaca while dancing in a circular fashion.
facts.author: unknown
